title: Introducing Cellulose - a tool to improve inference performance of ML models
description:
Hey folks!

My name is Zheng, and I‚Äôm the founder / CEO of Cellulose. Cellulose is a tool that helps ML engineers understand, fine tune, and improve the inference performance of their ONNX models. With Cellulose, they can eventually resolve these issues in just hours, not weeks.

Preparing ML models for production is a very manual and time consuming process. Unfortunately, it is also a necessary step for inference cost savings, sometimes even a hard requirement for certain fields like robotics and space tech. Today‚Äôs ML visualization tools are over 6 years old and lack basic features like integrating modern deep learning workflows.

Cellulose enables you to optimize and fine tune your models in a more automated fashion throughout your ML development lifecycle. We went with a product that leads with a visualizer core as so much of a ML model today is centered around the graph itself.

Cellulose has a bunch of utilities to help you copy specific values to the clipboard too, just in case you‚Äôd like to run offline experimental scripts with them.

We‚Äôre supporting Nvidia TensorRT as our first runtime. Under our Professional / Enterprise plans, we‚Äôll annotate the TensorRT compatibility / convertibility of each node in the graph.[1]

We also have an exciting roadmap, but more importantly, we‚Äôd like you to try it out (it‚Äôs free to start!) then we‚Äôll make sure to make those tweaks as soon as humanly possible.

I‚Äôd love the Lobsters community to give it a try. Feel free to sign up or browse our documentation here! Have questions or feedback? Just drop them in the thread below or send us an email at support@cellulose.ai. I‚Äôll have this tab open all day today to answer questions :)

[1] - We use onnx-tensorrt for the TensorRT compatibility checks.
description_plain:
Hey folks!

My name is Zheng, and I'm the founder / CEO of [Cellulose](https://www.cellulose.ai/). [Cellulose](https://www.cellulose.ai/) is a tool that helps ML engineers understand, fine tune, and improve the inference performance of their ONNX models. With Cellulose, they can eventually resolve these issues in just hours, not weeks.

Preparing ML models for production is a **very manual and time consuming process**. Unfortunately, it is also a necessary step for inference cost savings, sometimes even a hard requirement for certain fields like robotics and space tech. Today‚Äôs ML visualization tools are over 6 years old and lack basic features like integrating modern deep learning workflows.

Cellulose enables you to optimize and fine tune your models in a more automated fashion throughout your ML development lifecycle. We went with a product that leads with a visualizer core as so much of a ML model today is centered around the graph itself.

Cellulose has a bunch of utilities to help you copy specific values to the clipboard too, just in case you‚Äôd like to run offline experimental scripts with them.

We‚Äôre supporting Nvidia TensorRT as our first runtime. Under our Professional / Enterprise plans, we‚Äôll annotate the TensorRT compatibility /  convertibility of each node in the graph.[1]

We also have an [exciting roadmap](https://docs.cellulose.ai/roadmap/overview), but more importantly, we‚Äôd like you to try it out (it‚Äôs free to start!) then we‚Äôll make sure to make those tweaks as soon as humanly possible.

I‚Äôd love the Lobsters community to give it a try. Feel free to [sign up](http://dashboard.cellulose.ai/) or browse our [documentation here](https://docs.cellulose.ai/getting-started/introduction)! Have questions or feedback? Just drop them in the thread below or send us an email at support@cellulose.ai. I‚Äôll have this tab open all day today to answer questions :)

[1] - We use [onnx-tensorrt](https://github.com/onnx/onnx-tensorrt) for the TensorRT compatibility checks.
